definition: cannot be used/must not (do sth)/unacceptable
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: The nib is broken, it can't be used.
My dear sir, upon no account in the world; my father can direct me.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的先生，那可使不得，我父親會給我指路的。

definition: to not deserve (one's good fortune etc)
variant of 折殺|折杀[zhe2 sha1]
hurriedly/in a frenzy
to calm down/to quell one's anger
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
to smile apologetically or obsequiously
to wait a moment/do not go too soon
to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture)/crank handle
sir (respectful form of address for an old man)
in a great rush/in a flurry
interjection of surprise/Oh my!
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
benefactor
interjection of surprise or pain/Oh/Ow/My goodness!
to spare sb's life
to bow with hands held in front
